command: $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $pscp='pscp.exe'; $log="$env:ProgramData\NetAdmin\logs\T1597.log"; $host='sftp.riskiq.net'; $user=$env:RISKIQ_USER; $key=$env:RISKIQ_PPK; $hostkey=$env:RISKIQ_HOSTKEY; $remote='/illumination/exports/assets-expanded-2025-09-30.json.gz'; $dest='C:\Intel\RiskIQ\assets-expanded-2025-09-30.json.gz'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $dest) -Force | Out-Null; try { & $pscp -scp -batch -q -C -P 22 -i $key -hostkey $hostkey "$user@$host:$remote" "$dest"; if($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0){ throw "pscp exit code $LASTEXITCODE" }; $hash=(Get-FileHash -Algorithm SHA256 -Path $dest).Hash; $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; sha256=$hash; success=$true; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } catch { $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; success=$false; error=$_.Exception.Message; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } finally { $json=$status|ConvertTo-Json -Compress; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $log) -Force | Out-Null; Add-Content -Path $log -Value $json; Write-Output $json }
explanation: Transfers a subscription RiskIQ asset intelligence export over SCP with host key pinning and emits a JSON completion record.
rationale_steps: Authenticate to a paid asset intelligence provider using SSH keys.
Quietly collect a targeted export to reduce operational footprint.
Hash and log a JSON summary for downstream processing and audit.
Focused on closed-source collection, not delivery or exploitation.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with proper variable declarations, error handling with try/catch/finally blocks, balanced quotes/braces, and correct command separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by retrieving intelligence data from a paid threat intelligence source (RiskIQ) using proper authentication, logging the activity, and storing the retrieved data securely.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid flag formats, and correct cmdlet usage within a robust try/catch/finally block.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command precisely aligns with T1597 by retrieving an 'asset intelligence export' from 'sftp.riskiq.net' (a known threat intelligence provider), which represents acquiring non-public information from a paid feed or private database, using operationally plausible methods like SCP with host key pinning and robust logging.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is well-formed with balanced quotes/braces, valid parameters, proper separators, and correct try/catch/finally and hashtable usage.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It credibly downloads a paid RiskIQ export via SCP with host key pinning and logs a JSON record consistent with T1597, though using SCP against an SFTP-designated host may not work universally.
